p: ACO is an important Fe-S protease found in cells. When its Fe-S active centre is damaged by myocardial I/R injury, it is attacked by ROS, which inactivate ACO (Sami et al. 2019). Here, RosA was found to reduce oxidative inactivation of ACO in the myocardial I/R injury area in mice (7.6 ± 0.4 mU/mg protein vs. 4.2 ± 0.4 mU/mg protein, Figure 7(A)). RosA was also observed to reduce oxidative inactivation of ACO following OGD/R injury in cells (6.3 ± 0.6 mU/mg protein vs. 3.1 ± 0.5 mU/mg protein, Figure 7(B)).
